description: This perennial favorite is a modern-day speakeasy. The cramped space -- it seats only 100 -- is below street level, yet feels intimate rather than claustrophobic. Live jazz, whether Dixieland, New Orleans, or swing, belts out 6 nights a week. The epicenter for the swing dance craze in Toronto, this is still the place to watch glam hepcats groove.

reviews.title: One word describes Reservoir Lounge.. COOL !!
text: Coming from UK we just don't have these type of jazz/ blues dive bars and it was an awesome experience. We just rocked up on the night and paid 15 Cad entrance fee .. all of the tables were taken so stood at the bar .. The first thing you get is this incredible jazz vibe ..Everyone there was obviously having a great time. The band were sensational..the cocktails even better ..  It was a pleasure to be there . Just brilliant. !!  Highly recommended.. Bring your dancing shoes. !

reviews.title: Love Reservoir Lounge not Saturday‘talent’
text: Reservoir Lounge is great , especially with Tyler Yarema on a Saturday night .. sweaty jump blues .. now there’s Danny B .. he basically took the night off and read birthday greetings for most of his set and played maybe 5 songs ,  45 minute set.. .. most were ballads from the ‘40s .. Pennies from heaven ( ? ) .. not going back on a Saturday until he’s out of there , sorry 😞

reviews.title: Best night out in the city with friends
text: We had a spectacular night.  Louie was the highlight.   He treated us like gold.   He would make a great host.   The music was phenomenal.    Lady Mary , the pianist, the sax player, were all amazing.   Oh and the chocolate Martini!!!  Out of this world!!!   Best chocolate Martini anywhere

reviews.title: What is a low-rated performer,Danny B, doing as a Saturday regular in a top rate club like the Res?
text: Danny B is not worth seeing. Since he bullied his way in to the Saturday night spot at the Reservoir lounge, all the loyal regulars, and many musicians have had to leave.  We just can't stand his lack of energy, his bullying, or to hear him waddle his way through Georgia on my Mind at super-slow speed every week.  The only audience that is showing up is out-of-towners, who have read reviews from the pre-Danny B. performers.  And they won't be coming back for more.
Any of the other previous Reservoir acts would be better than this phony.  What is a low-rated performer,Danny B, doing as a Saturday regular in a formerly top-rate club like the Res?

reviews.title: Great night out!!!
text: This lounge offers great music with a live band. It is a jazz/blues lounge and is cozy with the dim lighting.  You can also dance if you choose to.  EXCELLENT martinis!! I wish I had taken some pictures.  Their strawberry coconut martini was soooo good.  We also had their chicken skewers and a flatbread pizza and crème brûlée.  Service was great as well.  Side note.. 10.00 cover charge but well worth it.  Looking forward to returning!!

reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
text: Not worth your time. Cancelled our reservation giving us a short amount of time to try and book somewhere else while visiting Toronto. They booked a private party so I guess customer service means nothing. Do yourself a favour and book elsewhere.

reviews.title: It Has The Vibe & The Music To Go With It
text: visited Toronto 3 weeks ago and  I always look for a jazz / blues club  where ever I go.  All of my research kept leading me to try the Reservoir Lounge and  the Poetry Room. I had some folks with us who had never experienced live blues/jazz club before so I wanted to get it right. I had 8 people in my party so I needed a reservation. That is the one and only negative. They don't have an online system and you have call at least a week out and leave a voicemail with your details. They do call back but I was a little nervous because of the popularity of the place. We were reserved for  Friday night at 8pm on the day of our arrival. We were going to be late because of some travel issues coming in from Buffalo. I called ahead to advise but had to leave a voicemail. I believe that I had to call back and actually got the owner on the phone this time. No problem changing our time to 8:45pm but I believe that we lost our prime time Seating at that point. We arrived at via Lyft and had to be dropped off probably a half block away because of construction in  the area. Upon entry you are greeted by the owner and a hostess and you pay your cover which is $20. I advise them that 2 people had dropped from our reservation ( They missed out ). We were anxious to get in because I could hear the set getting ready to start, so I didn't haggle about the US vs CA. They lead us to a table away from the front to a cozy little spot to the left and back against a wall. At first I was not to happy because it wasn't a front on site line, but we were late, so what was I gonna say? The place was almost packed and vibe was starting to jump. I love the darkness of the club. Our server came right away to get drinks and food started. I wish that I had written his name down because he gave us a lot of attention and we all loved this guy by the time we left. The drinks were great! This is one of the very few places we've been where my wife didn't send her drink back and even requested another round. I  did tell him that one of my long islands was a little weak and he told me that he would get the next one tightened up. The food selections are limited,  but most of us got the sliders and pizza and all of was great. That table location ended up being a good spot! It was cozy and we could see most of the band and the newbies in the group didn't have to worry about it being to loud. I would probably ask for this spot if I was ever to get back. The restrooms / sorry washrooms were small but clean. The group that played that night were fantastic! The lead vocalist had some soul inside of her! Would definitely recommend and wish that I had a spot like this in Houston Texas! We never made it to the Poetry Room so I can't offer a comparison.

reviews.title: Awesome Little Jazz Club
text: 10 of us visited in November of 2021 (just before everything shut down again due to Covid) to celebrate my birthday. We were quickly greeted at the door but I took away a point as one had to pay cash for the cover charge which I was not told when I made the reservations and most of my friends only carry plastic which was irritating as many had to run to a bank machine.  It is a cramped space but I knew this upon making the reservations and the food choice were quite limiting especially when I had one individual in the group who is gluten intolerant and another who is vegan but both did have at least once choice.  Although limited choices, I found the food was delicious (I had the burger sliders and the mushroom toast) and the atmosphere is electric.  The band was outstanding and everyone was up dancing again on the cramped dance floor.  It was a crowded space but as we had a table we were just fine. We all had a fantastic night and I would definitely go back again and same as last time ensure I reserved a table as otherwise it would just be too crowded for me with barely standing room. I took off one point simply due to the cash only cover charge (when everything else inside you could pay with plastic and no mention of this) and the limited menu but other than that would be 5 stars.

reviews.title: 65 th bday celebration
text: Felt warm and welcoming like I was in my living room with a live band of friends. Bartender skills were off the chart good!

reviews.title: Great Place!
text: The bands are incredible, the staff is even better and the atmosphere is unbeatable.  I highly recommend this location for a great evening out with friends.

reviews.title: Friday night with Didi
text: Wow, what a great time! We made a reservation as we are mature and wanted to sit and enjoy show. Food was good , service great. Music was the star, Friday night with Didi Martini, r& b , Motown and we were so happy to see so many young people enjoying this music that we grew up on. The place got very crowded but every one was enjoying the music, we closed the place.

reviews.title: Tasty Food & Great Vibes
text: I went on a Saturday night (days before Valentines) with my boyfriend, and we had a great time.  It was just what we needed: an intimate night of great live music and satisfying food.  We got there around 8:30/9pm, which worked out in time because we got the last table!  If you are going for dinner and drinks, I would advise making a reservation at least 2 days in advance (I couldn't the night before) if you want to sit at a table.  Otherwise, after 10pm it is standing room only.  By 11:30pm  the place is quite busy, and very lively.  The crowd was mixed, mainly 30+ in age.  The staff was excellent!  The lounge lost a star for me due to the closeness (and small size) of the tables, and lack of seating space.  Otherwise, Reservoir lounge is definitely a great night out with friends or on a hot date.

reviews.title: Go for the jazz - stay for the jazz!
text: I love stopping by here - it’s usually only a $10 cover to get in and the music can’t be beat! There are different live bands nightly.
The food menu is mediocre but really you’re there for the live music. Set your expectations low for food, drinks  and service.
Go early and make a reservation if you want a table, otherwise it’s standing room only and the room gets packed!!

reviews.title: Jazzy Night with the Gals!
text: This was the best jazzy night I have ever experienced! The Reservoir Lounge is an intimate basement joint with live jazz. The quality of jazz played was great, melodious, so much so, we were able to boogie too and I am from Trinidad & Tobago...so it was absolutely enjoyable!

reviews.title: Let the music begin
text: I really enjoy the place. Got there around 9:30 on Saturday night. The place was full but because someone just cancelled reservation we were offered a table. It was close to the music band. The place is very cozy with dim lights and brick wall. Very romantic I would say. The band was excellent. There were a lot of people dancing. At some point there was no room. We had drinks and crab cakes. They were good. I would recommend this place for good music and romantic atmosphere.

reviews.title: Great place !
text: Amazing music and good food (special mention for the pistachio crusted shrimps and the crème brûlée !!). The service was perfect too. I will come back !

reviews.title: Great Jazz
text: Went on a Tuesday night to watch Tyler Yarema. What a great jazz pianist plus his vocals were very good. Rich Underhill played the sax.  I'm a sax player, myself, so I'm usually very critical but I really enjoyed listening to Rich who really impressed. As far as the restaurant, we ordered pizza which was pretty good, though not great. But, hey, we went for the mysic. I really enjoyed the evening and would recommend for anyone who enjoys jazz music.

reviews.title: Evening of festivities
text: Awesome atmosphere, great crowd and fantastic band combined for a memorable evening! If you like jazz club atmosphere, that is a place you don't want to miss.

reviews.title: Brilliant Club with Brillant Music
text: This is a must visit club for any music fans. Watched The Digs do their stuff and they were great. Didn't eat here but drinks were reasonably priced and service was good.

reviews.title: Anniversary Trip to Canada!
text: What an awesome experience this lounge provides! Great service, great music, tasty food & drinks, and an awesome atmosphere! (At least it was for my wife and I) The entire staff is super sweet and take interest in all their customers. As soon as we mentioned we were from the US they offered suggestion for site seeing and more! Felt like I was chatting with old friends!  Now, to the drinks...I had the strawberry coconut martini which was tasty and refreshing! Drink it slow because it's THAT good! For food...if you like mushrooms you MUST order the Phyllo Rolls and Wild Mushroom Devil's Toast! Both were so yummy! The Rolls were flaky and full of flavor and the toast was EVERYTHING and then some! Our waitress Brooke was AMAZING! Hope you get her because she's super attentive and offers great advice on the menu. She even went the extra mile to bring us a plate of chocolate fondue with strawberries to help celebrate our anniversary! We will definitely be back and tell all of our friends!

reviews.title: Excellent music bad service and overcrowded
text: Stopped in to hear some piano playing.  Band was excellent!  However they let waaaay too many people into the place and the bartenders were slow, rude and aloof.  Too bad.  Won’t go back.

reviews.title: Please provide proper information
text: Since I know of people under the age of 19 who frequent this place my family did not question any age restriction as we talked to the manager about having to leave early due to my younger 14 year old brother (specifying the age) over the phone. If you are going to ID people maybe you should do that to everyone as clearly this is not the case, and also make it clear on your website of this rule. Also please have the person answering the phone giving out correct information when they are asked questions, I work in this industry it is not that hard, it requires a minimal amount of brain cells (unless you're intoxicated, which explains your eyes). The fact that not a single employee had the decency to simply apologize for the misunderstanding instead of insult my family tells us and all our friends what we need to know about this establishment and that continuing to go to The Rex Hotel Jazz and Blues Bar (194 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M5V 1Z1) is the better choice in both customer service, and overall atmosphere.

reviews.title: Wasn't sure
text: You walk down into the basement, open the door and wow it's crowded.
Since I was with a regular I got ushered over to where the band plays.
FYI Friday night band.....she's got pipes.
The atmosphere is cozy.
The only negative is they need more bar staff. Not east to get a drink.
This is a good "Check it out" place.

reviews.title: Loved it!
text: I came there by chance. Even big names of their past visitors didn't seduce me - I was simply looking for the jazz joint in Toronto on that Saturday night.
And I loved it instantly!
The place has this - almost forgotten - atmosphere of the small European underground jazz places, which are almost extinct now.
Full bar offers options for everyone's taste - from beer and wine (many choices) to cocktails. Amazing personnel. Live jazz music. Fancy crowd.
The place has it all. I was almost sorry to leave.

reviews.title: Happening Place
text: Really enjoyed this club.  The band played swing music and some jazz. The food was surprisingly good.  For a $5 cover pp. it is a great bargain.  We even danced a bit but the only dance floor (wood floor) was small and removed from the bandstand.  Still, the music was first rate and the vibe is very energetic.  Loved the “underground” ambiance of stone and brick walls. Staff were friendly and efficient.  Prices are good.

reviews.title: Great evening
text: The place is amazing, lovely band and great simple food , the service is wonderful. They have very little staff but they are doing there best .

reviews.title: Very Good Music - Very Good Food - FUN!
text: What impressed me about the Reservoir Lounge is the wait staff, food, atmosphere, and the music.OK, that's really most everything about the Reservoir Lounge...

After paying a $10 cover to get in, Tyler Yarema & His Rhythm jazzed us to the bar where we started a tab and stood nearby along the back wall. That tab followed us to a table that we snagged and enjoyed some noodles, skewers, pot stickers, and more drinks. Everything was good.
The vibe was friendly-party-in-new-Orleans and we thoroughly enjoyed the characters and the antics.
Spent a couple of hours and $75 for a great time.

reviews.title: A good place to check out the local jazz scene.
text: An intimate place to enjoy jazz music and a beer and a short wallk from Younge St. A safe area for walkers.

The layout is music stage next to the front door and a rectangular hall to the back.  A long table is in the middle and the bar is on the right side.  The corner of the bar is the best spot for enjoying the music.   A band from Germany was playing that night.

reviews.title: The Complete Package for a Night Out
text: Dinner included tapas and other dishes that we shared (crab cakes, scallops, pot stickers, pizzas, etc.). The food was good and pizza impressive. We had the sexy Italian and a mushroom pizza, nice thin crust.The service was attentive, prompt and friendly. The band came on 9:45 pm as expected. The music was the cherry on top of the evening. As mentioned in other reviews, everyone stands around two feet from the band making it impossible to see them--it's an odd phenomena but it didn't damper the evening. Party goers were friendly and bubbly. Can't wait to return. $10 cover was worth every penny.

reviews.title: Nice place, Nice Jazz?
text: Food good and the place is a nice location for jazz, on our visit the band were just ok, although the place was packed and lively. would advise booking a table, otherwise you will be standing. How good your experience is will depend upon the act, or if you are not to bothered about actual jazz and just out for a lively night and dancing then this would be the place for you.

reviews.title: Great Jazz Club
text: Loved the ambiance of this intimate Jazz Club, the decor was really nice, the customer service was impressive and the food and drinks were delicious. Very unique culinary choices that raised the bar, my expectation was exceeded. The music was very enjoyable. I would definitely come back when in Toronto. Definitely a must do, make reservations!

reviews.title: A unique place that shouldn’t be missed
text: This is a charming jazz club that is crowded, fun, intimate and all around a good time. The food is pretty good, drinks are generous but let’s face it you are going there for the music and dancing. The crowd is definitely 30+, it is not really a pickup bar, but it’s a great date place for dinner or after dinner dancing

reviews.title: Great music- Good food
text: We went with friends last week.  We made a reservation for dinner; that is the only way to reserve a table in advance.  Food was very good, with more options than I expected.  We had caesar  salad, coconut shrimp and flat bread pizza - all delicious.  The cocktails were delicious also.

reviews.title: Great Place
text: We have visited this place many times.  It is small and intimate.  The music is really good.  I would recommend making a reservation if you want to get a table.  You can get up and dance as there is a small dance floor but people dance whereever they are.  Food and drinks are good.  Definitely worth a visit!

reviews.title: Evening entertainment
text: I am glad I was told about the place by the hotel concierge, however I failed to find it initially. Then I did, it is a cellar bar, which I didn't expect. (There was a 'cover charge' 7$ for entry) It has a really intimate, relaxed atmosphere, the whole place being lit by candlelight. Beer was great as was the service. Food on offer with a variety of dishes available.  I arrived around 9.15pm in time for the first set of the 'Band' playing. The music on offer from the Jazz combo was superb, a mix of moody and lively, played by tremendously talented musicians. The second set featured more up tempo music and the bar started to fill up by around 11pm. A great atmosphere I can highly recommend!!

reviews.title: Good music-but loud!
text: Had drinks and nibbles here.  Very busy place with lots of noise.  Food was good.  We shared small platters like tapas with good seafood selection.

reviews.title: Best music in town
text: Small place with absolutely wonderful music. First quality jazz. Good drinks and beer. Crowded, but with space enough to enjoy the night.

reviews.title: Dessert in a glass and good music
text: First of all the “chocolate storm martini” is simply dessert in a glass. It is delicious. All of the cocktails and martinis we chose were. The live music was incredible and a diverse clientele. We will be back. And we will bring friends.

reviews.title: Like a can of sardines
text: Went to the Reservoir Lounge with a large group of girls, No tables unless you are prepared to spend some $$ on food. The live band was amazing. By the time the Leafs game got out, there was not a place to move in the bar. Good luck getting a drink or navigating to the washroom. We would have actually stayed all night if it wasn't so busy. No fault of the servers who were doing an amazing job despite all of the people crammed in. On a regular night I'm sure this place is great, I liked the mix of people from old to young enjoying live jazz.

reviews.title: Great Music/Food/ Service
text: We had a large group of 16 for dinner.  The server was amazing and the music even better.  Great venue in Toronto.
I think it was a $10 cover charge to get in even when having dinner.  Had a hard time getting through for reservations but well worth it.
